She coordinated very unique vegan, vegetarian, gluten free, and even some meat options with the tapa dishes. I M P R E S S E D!!!!! #RealFood

resp.text: Thank you, Jamie. I appreciate your review it was a pleasure working with you and your group. What a wonderful dinner we had and a beautiful occasion. Thank you for using Lean Bean Chef and for choosing me for your event.

name: Cassie Federoff
text:
My story goes something along the lines of, I wanted to do something with my friend that we hadn't done before. Most friends get together and eat. We had the opportunity to take it up a notch!
The Lean Bean Chef, Susan, did a fantastic job teaching us how to prepare some delicious Thai food! I don't know which was most enjoyable, the guided lesson and history of the cuisine, or the overly satisfied taste buds!? Many memories were made!
Lean Bean Chef surpassed my expectations!

resp.text: Cassie, thank you for your wonderful review. It was such a joy teaching you both in your private cooking class, you were terrific students. You made my job fun and enjoyable with your enthusiasm for cooking, friendship and food. I'm so glad I could help you create lasting memories through this experience. Thank you for using Lean Bean Chef! - Chef Susan

name: T MK
text: My Husband and I were looking for something to do other than going out to eat. We found Susan's class and it did not disappoint!  We learned a lot and had a great time!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind review. It was so great having you and your husband in our healthy eating cooking class! You were such an asset to the group! We look forward to having you again at one of our upcoming cooking classes in Dothan! - Chef Susan

name: Chris W
text: My father is a diabetic and just had a heart attack. This came with a lot of new eating restrictions and my mother was overwhelmed. We reached out and Chef Susan came in without skipping a beat. She helped my father understand that healthy doesn't have to mean tasteless. She helped my mother with healthy alternatives to things she already knew and new ways to think about leading a healthier life going forward.  Despite the limitations put on Lean Bean Chef, our expectations were continually exceeded. If you are thinking that you need chef services, go for it, you will not be disappointed.

resp.text: Chris, thank you for your kind comments regarding my services. These situations can certainly be extremely overwhelming. Having someone to help guide you in these times can be so helpful, I know from my own personal experiences. So glad I was able to help your family during this time of transition.

name: Kim Starr
text: I am a Diabetic and I have to watch what I eat because of that. I have had several meals from Lean Bean Chef made especially for me with that in mind. They are made fresh, with local, organic ingredients and are delicious and healthy choices. Being a Diabetic doesn't mean having to cut out flavor - but I can now find satisfaction eating healthy and knowing I can keep the diabetes under control. If you haven't tried Lean Bean Chef Personal Chef Service you are missing something special. I think Lean Bean Chef is the Best Personal Chef Service in Dothan.

resp.text: Thank you, Kim. Being diabetic can be quite the challenge especially when knowing what you are supposed to eat and not eat. I'm thrilled I could help out in guiding you along this journey to better health and nutrition. - Chef Susan

name: Richard Deguzman
text: I just had to take the opportunity and say that Lean Bean Chef, Susan takes the time to listen to and take into account what your health goals are, and likes and dislikes of food.   She incorporates all the feedback to prepare the most perfect meals.  It is so wonderful to come home after a long day at work and know that there are healthy, very delicious meals waiting for me, and there is no mess to clean up.  The food is amazing and has helped in my recovery from C-Spine surgery.  It's a one of kind experience that I will continue because of the outstanding and professional service that she offers.  I have never hired or used a Personal Chef before.  Some of my favorites are Garlic Butter Brazilian Steak w/Collard Greens, Coconut Tofu Curry w/Red Pepper and Spinach w/Brown Rice, Slow Cooked Salmon w/Chickpeas and Greens, Humble Sriracha Roasted Wild Rice Buddha Bowl, and Short Ribs in Tomato Fennel Sauce to name a few.  Whether you're in need of a Personal Chef for you health goals, or an event, Chef Susan is the one to choose.  Simply the best that the Wiregrass  has to offer.

resp.text: Rich, thank you so much for taking time out to share your experience with Lean Bean Chef regarding the service you have been receiving. It means so much that you would take the time out of your busy schedule to let others know how much you value what we do. We are so grateful to have you as a client and hope to continue to provide you with the best experience all around. Chef Susan

text: I have experienced a few of the dishes (curry black bean lime rice, Budda bowl, blueberry muffins, and roasted vegetables) and they are delightfully flavorful, healthy, satisfying, with a beautiful presentation. I would highly recommend Lean Bean Chef for even the most discriminating palette.

resp.text: Dear Zephani, we are overjoyed that your experience with LEAN BEAN CHEF has been so great and that you chose to let others know. We hope that you will continue to encounter such deliciousness going forward with Lean Bean Chef! All our Best!

resp.text: Becky, thank you for your kind review of our Food! We always strive to provide the best final end product with the freshest ingredients and love it when folks take time to tell us how they feel about it!

name: Jessica Turner
text: Tina and her team were amazing to work with and worth EVERY PENNY! After our consultation, my mom and I were very impressed with Tina’s experience, professionalism and thoroughness! It was incredibly easy to make our decision to hire her. Throughout the months of planning, Tina was always a phone call/ text away and always responded promptly. She made the stress of the Bride (myself) and mother of the bride essentially nonexistent (there’s always a little stress we will feel while planning). Her ideas were consistent with trends, which I appreciated very much. She also had a way of making my dreams for my wedding and my mom’s vision come together to be what we both wanted. On the day of our wedding Tina and her team made the day go seamlessly. She made me feel as if I was the only one who mattered and like I was her own daughter whom she wanted everything to go perfect for. Her idea of the candy/ popcorn bar was a complete hit! My guests are still talking about how they loved it!! Tina and Hannah also did a phenomenal job keeping up with our other vendors and making sure everyone was punctual and improvised when the cake arrived damaged (which I had no idea until the end.. thank goodness). I cannot be thankful enough that our paths crossed and she became our coordinator. The relationship she builds with her customers is something that is true and genuine. You will not regret hiring InStyle Weddings & Events for your big day or special event. Thank you Tina, Hannah, Greg and the rest of the crew for all you did for us.

name: Reds Vibe
text: TIna is the BEST! She calmed every nerve and took care of EVERYTHING. She coordinated every vendor and worked with the venue! Tina made sure everything was covered. It was such a huge help and relief! She suggested amazing vendors and worked well with all of them! The wedding went off without a hitch and Tina was the one who made it happen!! She also has great rentals that helped personalize my wedding, they set everything up and took it all down! SO sweet, professional, and helpful!!

resp.text:
Elaine, it was our absolute pleasure to help you create this beautiful memory that you, family and friends will have for a lifetime.

May God Bless You In Your New Life Together.
InStyle Weddings and Events, Planning and Design Services

name: Karen Terry
text: If you want the most beautiful and stress free wedding, you need Miss Tina. She is so kind, thorough, and professional. She is an amazing wedding planner and a wonderful person.

resp.text: Karen and Scott, this makes me so very happy,  that you are happy. What we always strive to remember is this, this one day in your lives you will always remember for a lifetime,. and I want this to truly be “your Best Day ever”.  Congratulations!

name: chattfiremike
text: Tina Murray and her team at In Style Weddings are amazing!!! They were so responsive and accommodating, always providing feedback for any question, big or small, and always went out of their way to make sure everything for my wedding was taken care of. Lecia, my day of coordinator, made sure that all of the décor for the reception was taken care of two days in advance and set everything out-it looked absolutely gorgeous. Everything she did relieved me and my mom of so much day-of stress. Hannah, my bride's assistant, was at my side during all of the pictures before the ceremony, holding my flowers when I needed help with my dress, adjusting my train, pinning my hair back and making sure my veil was in place at all times. She was truly a lifesaver and made it so easy for me to enjoy taking pictures and had everything you could possibly need from bobbie pins, to a mirror, to a glass of water. Tina is extremely honest and straight forward, which I LOVE. I always felt that she had my best interest in mind and would give me the best advice so I could make decisions regarding all aspects of the wedding. I am not from Chattanooga, so I had questions about almost every vendor and she never steered me wrong. She was so much fun to get to know and from the beginning, I felt at ease with her, knowing she was going to be on top of everything for the reception. Since I had a church ceremony, she did not coordinate for that, but she made sure to know all of the details and really took my vision and made it a reality for the entire event. If you are looking for a coordinator, and don't want to spend a fortune, In Style Weddings is the way to go. They do not sacrifice professionalism or quality of service, they are extremely helpful, can fit into almost any bride's budget, and are absolutely worth every penny for the peace of mind they provide! I am so thankful to have had Tina and her team help make my wedding day perfect for my husband and me!

name: Paige Pertuit
text: I cannot say enough nice things about Tina and Lecia. We originally were not going to hire a planner because we thought we had everything under control, but I'm SO glad we did. It saved my mom and I so much stress the day of. Lecia went above and beyond. My wedding would not have been near as great without her. She is so sweet, professional, and really knows her stuff! Thank you for everything!

name: Dennis Evans
text: This is a great place to have family reunion, Christmas parties, church concert this is the place, the staff is friendly the building is clean inside and outside with a large parking lot.

name: Thomas Baker
text: Not a fan

name: Scottie English
text: Very nice store

name: Maxure Underwood
text: Good

name: Andrea Dobynes
text: The food was delicious, well portioned, and plated beautifully. Our server was very polite,  helpful,  and a joy to meet. The place was clean, spacious,  and vibrant.  I highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you for the opportunity to server! We hope to see you again soon.

name: Michael Ferranti
text: This place is gorgeous, Lexi was fantastic! THIS should be THE hot spot!

name: Sofia Ceresia
text: Went at night for a date party and they tried confiscating my real ID and were very rude and condescending towards me when I insisted it was real. I challenged them on it so, reluctantly, the bouncer let me in but said it would be “just this one time”... so if it had been a fake ID, he would have just let it go?? Not to mention, had to wait a long time for mediocre drinks.

resp.text: Sofia, I would like to apologize for how we made you feel. That said, the security team deals with and see a lot when it comes to checking for real and fake ID's. Thank you for the opportunity to serve.

name: Nicholas Bien
text: Great food and good drinks.

name: Bryan Council
text: Fast friendly curbside delivery. The smokehouse burger with onion rings were perfect. Twelve 25 will be part of our dining rotation going forward.

name: Smilez
text: I went on 25cent wing night, its also $2 wine and $5 double wells. This was all on a Wednesday. Wings were good.

name: Renee Bjorn
text:
Great outdoors, happy people, wonderful food.
Will go back many times over and over.

name: Spencer Nickey
text: Great place to eat... Been there twice already and will be there next week to eat again..

name: Stephen Rush
text: If you don't get the chicken fingers and sweet potato fries for lunch then you're missing out!

name: Mandy Nall
text: I've been a loyal patron of Country's BBQ since they opened their door for business on Zelda Road. It's truly the BEST BBQ locally.  Everything on the menu is homemade.  They offer everything from the best variety picks of vegetables (sweet potato is the bomb and HUGE, fried okra, corn on the cob, great fried green tomatoes are so yummy, field peas, mashed potatoes, cabbage… all recommended). The Q stew, i.e.:Brunswick stew is a winner. ALL PORK AND BEEF platters, inside or outside chopped, served with 1 or 2 sides,  French bread or cornbread will fill you up with a to-go box for sure. The ribs fall off the bone,  and I truly recommend the chef salad.  All dressings are homemade. Price per person is about $10-14 for a full meal. Homemade lemonade and sweet tea are outstanding. Don't forget dessert.  The pecan pie and lemon pie are the best around. If you've got the time to wait, their steaks are excellent too. Chopped steak is my favorite, the fried chicken fingers are so crisp and tender. My kids love them. They cater too, and do a very good job. Try a nearby Country's,  you won't be disappointed,  I promise.

name: Jeremy English
text: Had the special, pulled pork plate. It was honestly great, sauce was pleasing and not too sweet. The sweet tea was outstanding, service was good, it wasn't crowded at all when I went. A little pricey at $13+, though.

name: Linda H
text: I am very impressed with the owner of this establishment. If for some reason you have any problem, he will immediately take care of it for you. I suppose any of us can have a less than favorable experience, anywhere, at any time. I know first hand that Mr. Powell appears to care that his customers have a favorable experience!

resp.text: Dear Linda H, I greatly apologize for your experience this weekend with Country's Barbecue. That is not how I want our customers to be dining on a holiday! Please call me at the corporate office so I can make it up to you. Sincerely, Mark Powell 271-2017

name: Cynthia P
text: Can't wrong with Country's BBQ.  I've never ordered anything I didn't enjoy.  They have a great club Sammy, a great (big) salad, great chopped pork, delicious sides and so much more!!  If you don't give them a try, you will be missing out on a great meal.

name: UnicornPoo OnU
text: This is the second time me and my girlfriend have eaten here. The first time it was ok but nothing to write home about and tonight made the first time seem like a great experience. She got the pulled pork sandwich and fries. The pork was tough and cold and the fries were cold and covered in grease. I got the Larry's Special which is supposed to be tenderloin marinated in special sauce, and fries. The meat came out just slightly warm and the fries were cold and covered in grease. When they refer to their special sauce, what the menu should say is that the meat has been swimming in Dale's Sauce for about a week and is almost too salty to eat. The waiter asked how the food was, which was obviously a formality because when I told him he acted as if I'd said the food was great and walked away. That's the last $30 this place will ever get out of me.

resp.text: Hi Jonathan, I am sorry you were less than happy with your recent experience at our Zelda Rd. location. Everyone can have a bad day and maybe you caught us on one of ours. Please call me at the corporate office (271-2017) so I can make it up to you. I hope you'll give us another try. Sincerely, Mark Powell - Owner

name: Brian Wilson
text: Loved our experience at Country's BBQ on Zelda Road in Montgomery!  Highly recommend to anyone for some of the best BBQ in the River Region.  Wife and I thoroughly enjoyed the food and the sauces were to DIE FOR!

name: K&A GrassBusters
text: Ordered to go at Zelda Rd. I give a 2 star only because the stew and the tea was good.  My fiance order was messed up she ordered Okra and got fries cold fries at that also we didn't get the bread with our order. We changed from the Atlanta Hwy location to Zelda Rd because ATL Hwy messed our order up big time with my whole family it took us months to eat at Country's again probably will just cook my own from now on seeing the one place that had it together when I was growing surely doesn't have it any more

name: Jessie Godfrey
text: The food was fantastic and the service was spot on! Had the chef salad with homemade ranch with pulled pork with bacon! Yes, it was as amazing as it sounds!

name: Kaleigh Flatt
text: Great place for lunch.  I always get the vegetable plate or the brunswick stew.  And of course a giant sweet tea!

name: Tech Man
text: 2 or 3 times a year I drive from Atlanta to Mobile and back, this is my halfway point. I do not miss stopping in for lunch in both directions! Always great food and smiles!

name: Jacob Sterrett
text: Absolutely delicious, we had the barbeque platters with two of the sides from the infinite selection. Meat was great, they had wonderful sauces as well. Would reccomend 5/5!

name: Pamala Howell-Paoli
text: We were travelling through and looked on our phone to see what BBQ places were here. To my enthusiasm n surprise, Country's BBQ. I grew up in Columbus, Ga and go back from time to time. And EVERY TIME I do go back 1st place I stop is Country's. I LOVE Columbus Country BBQ and longed for it. About 3pm when we first walked in, the Mgr told us "to walk over there, grab a menu and seat where ever we wanted". There was 2 other couples in dining area. The waitress was outstanding!! I don't remember her name, but she was super bubblely. But we were so disappointed with the food. I ordered my usual; pulled pork platter. Husband ordered his usual; 1/2 chicken. Well the pork was drowned in chutney n coleslaw juices, which totally ruined the taste mainly b/c I don't like chutney. I used a numerous amount of napkins to dry up the juice. Husband's chicken looked liked it was cooked the day before or real early that morning. The BBQ sauce was dried and skin was wrinkled up and some spots were burnt. It was very dry. Husband informed waitress and she was very helpful and offered another one, fresher or something else. He ordered another chicken. The 2nd chicken was a more moist but didn't compare to the taste of Country's in Columbus. If Jim is affiliated with this establishment, he would be ashamed. Also, the Mgr had fixed a plate for herself and sat and ate. Not once did she come over to ask about why we sent it back.  How convenient it would've been since we travel through Montgomery often and it's closer than Columbus for us. Needless to say, we won't be coming back or if by some chance we do, we will hope to remember and not order the same thing.......

resp.text:
Dear Pamala,

I am so sorry to hear about your recent experience at our Zelda Road location. I am glad your waitress was wonderful, but I am disappointed to hear about your food experience. Thank you for bringing these issues to my attention so I can address them immediately. I would like to make it up to you! Please give me a call at the corporate office... 334-271-2017

Sincerely,
Mark Powell, Owner

name: Jim Davis
text: My wife and I have been stopping at Country's for over 25 years when traveling between Atlanta and Pensacola FL. The BBQ is excellent, sweet potatoes are hugh, the backfire slaw is tangy, and the fried green tomatoes are outstanding. We love this restaurant.

name: MARJORIE BAKER
text: Excellent, excellent barbecue, great brunswick stew, top notch chef salad and good southern sweet tea.  Would just ask them to work on appearance of restaurant, particularly the drive thru area.  Needs a bit of cleaning at the window, outside and inside.

name: Robert Smith
text: This was the first time we have eaten at (take out) Country's BBQ (night of 23 Feb 2015).  I am not sure if the staff was just busy at time of order or what.  While calling in the order the person taking the order seemed inpatient. We picked up the order 10 minutes later and noticed there was only one person dining in Country's BBQ, 4 staff in the kitchen and one or two staff in the dining area. About 4 orders were picked up while we waited 10 more minutes (added item to order) for our order. After getting home I realized my 1/2 and 1/2 order of fried pickles and onions was far from being fried.  In fact it was very clear they had gone straight from the container to my take out container. Not cooked what-so-ever. I was soo disappointed. Was really looking forward to trying the side dishes. Now I travel a lot and have been to great BBQ places across the US and outside the US and this is definetly not one of them. Anyone who says Country's BBQ is great has not had good BBQ. Aside from the poorly prepared side dishes the BBQ (chicken and beef) was just okay, definetly not worth mentioning. Being that the food was just okay at best there was no reason to call and complain as we would have only gotten more phone attitude.  Would not recommend this place.

resp.text:
Dear Robert,
Please allow us to apologize. We get a lot of good comments about our marinated barbecue onions. We have garnished our plates with these for 33 years. We only started frying these a short while ago. I have found the ticket for that evening and it is obvious that we filled the order with or regular marinated onions not fried… The order the chef got reflected barbecue onions and pickles, not fried or half-n-half. A simple miscommunication.  Please feel free to call the corporate office anytime you are not satisfied. 334-271-2017. I would be glad to forward you a replacement coupon or a refund. Thank you for taking the time to advise us.  Your business is sincerely appreciated.
Sincerely,
Mark Powell, Owner

name: Heather Jaquis
text: Very good southern barbeque. Not overly expensive and not a chain which was nice to have on a business trip.

name: Aaron Dettling
text: I love this place and try to eat here every time I'm in Montgomery.

text: The Sweet Tea and the CFS can't be beat.

name: Al carl
text: Customer service was horrendous.  Our bill was double it should have been, and though we disputed it, they basically wouldn't honor the prices that the waitress had CLEARLY quoted us. Skip it, people.

resp.text: Al carl, Please allow me to apologize, We certainly don’t want to overcharge anyone. Please contact us at the corporate office by e-mail or telephone, Mpowell@montgomerybbq.com or 334-271-2017. We get a lot of good comments about our service and food, but we also make our share of mistakes. Please give us a chance to correct our actions.

name: UnbiasedReport
text: I just let myself in. No, my whole family and I just let ourselves in. The room was unlocked. No one was around. No one was on site to be reached about reserving the space. Perhaps it was just bad timing.

name: Kesa Stephenson
text: I really love the service I received from this company! My kids loved everything . I will definitely use again.
